msDesc.head: Theology: Hugh of Fouilly, Ralph of Battle, Bernard, Augustine

msItem.rubric: Tractatus magistri HUGONIS DE FOLIETO super nouein beneficiis religionis
msItem.incipit: Avdiant seculares quos delectatio temporalium retinet qui religionis abhorrent habitum
msItem.explicit: accedas et sine reuerentia et sine deuotione
msItem.author: HUGH OF FOUILLY
msItem.title: De claustro animae
msItem.note: beginning in book 1, ch. 8, ed. PL 176:1033 A 6–1086 C 8. Book 2 is presented as if it is a separate text, ‘de xij. abusionibus claustri’, beginning at fol. 14.

msItem.rubric: Quod sint octo que obseruantes monachi non nimis esse segnes sui ordinis a quoquod facile sunt iudicandi
msItem.incipit: Octo sunt que si diligenter a monachis obseruantur per horum obseruantiam
msItem.explicit: usque in finem perseuerauerit uitam eternam sine dubio possessurus est
msItem.author: RALPH OF BATTLE
msItem.title: 'De octo a monachis observandis'
msItem.note: (Sharpe, no. 1234 [444]), ed. (as LANFRANC, ‘Sermo sive sententiae’) PL 150:637–40; and Hugh Farmer, ‘Ralph’s Octo Puncta of Monastic Life’, Studia Monastica 11 (1969), 19–29. The remainder of this booklet and item 11 below contain an anthology of Ralph’s shorter pieces, almost certainly copied, selectively but in the same text order, from BodL, MS Laud misc. 363, where this text appears at fols. 27–9. Laud misc. 363 is a book of s. xii returned to St Albans c.1345 by Richard de Bury bishop of Durham, or his executors (see Ker, MLGB 168, 300). See further R. W. Southern, ‘St Anselm and his English Pupils’, MARS 1 (1941), 3–34 at 25–8; and St Anselm and his Biographer (Cambridge, 1966), 206–9, 321. In the first of these discussions, Southern argues that BL, MS Royal 12 C.i represents Ralph’s corrected versions of his texts (and is the source of Royal 7 A.iii) but that the Laud MS derives from an unedited predecessor version.

msItem.rubric: Meditatio cuiusdam cristiani de fide et quia multa que secundum fidem credimus et secundum rationem intelligimus
msItem.incipit: Quicunque in sanctitate desiderat proficere non eum tedeat omni hora se inspicere
msItem.explicit: In cor eius ascenderet que diligentibus se deus preparauit Ad hanc leticiam nos peruenire faciat filius dei [form ending] Amen
msItem.note: Unpublished; equivalent to Laud misc. 363, fols. 33v–43.

msItem.rubric: De hoc quod dicitur quia spiritus sanctus amor est et de processione eius a patre et a filio
msItem.incipit: Superius dixi quia spiritus sanctus amor dicitur propter amorem videlicet quo se inuicem diligunt
msItem.explicit: quod sicut iam multotiens diximus predestinati uel presciti ad bonum vel ad malum
msItem.note: Unpublished; equivalent to Laud misc. 363, fols. 43–6v.

msItem.rubric: Fides exposita quomodo credatur unus deus trinitas et trinitas unus deus
msItem.incipit: Credo adoro et veneror vnum deum in trinitate et trinitatem in vnitate
msItem.explicit: eos autem qui bona fecerunt ducet cum magna gloria ad regnum celorum
msItem.note: Unpublished; equivalent to Laud misc. 363, fols. 49–52v.

msItem.rubric: Quid dicere sit dei et quia quemadmodum uerbo dei facta est creatura ita eodem uerbo facto caro fit panis et vinum eiusdem uerbi caro et sanguis in celebratione misse
msItem.incipit: Inter ominia mirabilia que deus fecit nichil tam mirabile tamquam vehementer stupendum est
msItem.explicit: ad salutem nostram comedere et bibere qui nos in hiis asserit se comedere et bibere Amen
msItem.note: Unpublished; equivalent to Laud misc. 363, fols. 52v–3.

msItem.rubric: De creatore et creatura et quid inter se differunt creature Capitulum
msItem.incipit: Due res sunt scilicet creator et creatura vnam de hiis duabus rebus videmus
msItem.explicit: per ineffabilem bonitatem tuam perduc ad gloriam tue eterne contemplationis Amen
msItem.note: Unpublished; equivalent to Laud misc. 363, fols. 53–5v.

msItem.rubric: Quod omnia deus bona fecit et quod ipse essentialiter semper bonus fuit et est et erit
msItem.incipit: Suauissime et dulcissime domine ihesu criste qui es pius amator hominum et benignissimus redemptor
msItem.explicit: inenarrabilem gloriam cum omnibus sanctis tuis in eterna felicitate possidere per eterna secula Amen
msItem.note: A series of meditations and prayers, at one time ascribed to ANSELM OF BEC. This ascription was demolished by André Wilmart, Auteurs spirituelles et textes dévots au moyen âge (Paris, 1932), 158–61 and the pieces re-ascribed to RALPH OF BATTLE by Southern (1941). The MS presents:

the incipit, equivalent to Laud misc. 363, fols. 55v–9v, ed. as ANSELM, meditatio 19, beginning with ch. 3, PL 158:805; the incipit of the text as printed (PL 158:803) appears at fol. 57v, and the selection includes material not in the printed text.

msItem.rubric: Vnde viuat anima et vnde uiuat caro et de gloria bone anime et de infelicitate male anime quando exeunt a corpore
msItem.incipit: Cum anima manet in corpore viuit homo secundum carnem
msItem.note: equivalent to Laud misc. 363, fols. 59v–61, ed. as ANSELM, meditatio 5, PL 158:733–6.

msItem.rubric: De peccatore quomodo excitet animam suam ad corrigenda peccata sua
msItem.incipit: Anima mea anima misera et feda diligenter recollige ad te intrinsecus
msItem.note: equivalent to Laud misc. 363, fols. 62–4, ed. as ANSELM, meditatio 4, PL 158:729–33.

msItem.rubric: Oratio ne pro ullo peccato desperare debeat peccator quia pius est et misericors dominus et non mortem peccatoris sed uitam desiderat
msItem.incipit: Miserere mei deus Credimus quod hanc orationem spiritus sanctus dictauit
msItem.note: equivalent to Laud misc. 363, fols. 65–7, ed. as ANSELM, oratio 6, PL 158:872–5.

msItem.rubric: Oratio ne desperemus quia si ueram penitenciam agimus veram misericordiam sine dubio de omnibus nostris peccatis inueniemus
msItem.incipit: Cum ad peccata que feci respicio et penas et tormenta intelligo
msItem.note: equivalent to Laud misc. 363, fols. 67–70, ed. as ANSELM, meditatio 6, PL 158:736–40.

msItem.rubric: Oratio ad cristum cumpeccator reminiscitur que cristus pro peccatoribus fecit
msItem.incipit: Ad te dulcissime deus et benignissime domine ihesu qui fons pietatis
msItem.note: equivalent to Laud misc. 363, fols. 76–8, ed. as ANSELM, oratio 15, PL 158:888–91.

msItem.rubric: Incipiunt Meditationes beati BERNARDI CLAREUALLIS abbatis De cognitione dei Capitulum Im.
msItem.incipit: Multi multa sciunt et seipsos nesciunt alios inspiciunt et semetipsos deserunt
msItem.explicit: in quo sponsum cum sponsa perspicies vnum eundem dominum glorie qui vivit [form ending]
msItem.author: PS.-BERNARD
msItem.title: Meditationes

msItem.rubric: Liber BERNARDI de precepto et dispensatione Epistola sancti BERNARDI abbatis CLAREUALLENSIS ad abbatem Columbensem de sequenti opere
msItem.incipit: Domino Abbati Columbensi frater Bernardus dictus Abbas de Claraualle ualere [marg.] in domino semper Rescriptum meum ad epistolas duorum Carnotensium
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber beati BERNARDI abbatis CLAREUALLIS de precepto et dispensatione Capitulum I.
msItem.incipit: Qua mente iam tacebo qua fronte tamen loquar crebris epistolis et nunciis
msItem.explicit: siue in paucis siue in multis vestre debui quod et studui satisfacere voluntati
msItem.author: BERNARD OF CLAIRVAUX
msItem.title: De precepto et dispensatione
msItem.note: Ed. Leclercq et al., Opera, vol. III (Rome, 1963), 253–94, where our MS is not noted.

msItem.rubric: De perpetua virginitate sancte Marie et de ueritate corporis et sanguinis domini
msItem.incipit: De nostra domina sancta Maria dulcissima matre domini nostri ihesu cristi credimus quod ipsa
msItem.explicit: de virgine sumpsit nec cum intrauit nec cum de illa exiuit eius virginitatem uiolauit
msItem.author: RALPH OF BATTLE
msItem.note: equivalent to Laud misc. 363, fols. 31v–3v.

msItem.rubric: Liber BERNARDI de xii. gradibus humilitatis Incipit prologus in libellum sancti BERNARDI abbatis de xii. gradibus humilitatis Prologus
msItem.incipit: In hoc opusculo cum in euangelio illud quod dominus ait diem vltimi iudicii [the text] Rogasti me frater Gaufride quatinus ea que de gradibus humilitatis
msItem.explicit: quos ascendendo melius tu in corde tuo quam in nostro codice leges
msItem.author: BERNARD OF CLAIRVAUX
msItem.title: De xii. gradibus humilitatis
msItem.note: Ed. Leclercq et al., 15–59.

msItem.rubric: Incipit liber BERNARDI de ordine uite et morum institucione capitulum I
msItem.incipit: Morum insignia et ornamenta virtutum in illis proculdubio cernimus
msItem.explicit: nutrit huius seculi desertum que necligentes monachos duris morsibus depascunt
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber BERNARDI [as the initial rubric]
msItem.author: PS.-BERNARD
msItem.title: De ordine vitae

note.p: ed. PL 184:561 B 1–583 A 13 (slightly less than the whole). Fol. 140v has only five written lines.
Beneath the explicit an added note (anglicana, s. xv2): ‘quicquid enim sine peccato mortali potest omitti vitandum est pocius quam ex excercio eius scandalum oriatur secundum SCOTUM’.

msItem.rubric: Incipit Epistola BERNARDI ad Assellinum ecclesie Romane cardinalem et cancellarium de diligendo deum
msItem.incipit: Uiro illustri domino Assellino ecclesie romane diacono cardinali et cancellario BERNARDUS abbas dictus DE CLARAUALLE domino viuere et in domino mori Orationes a me et non questiones poscere solebatis
msItem.explicit: locus aut misericordie tempus vbi nullus profecto esse potent miserationis affectus
msItem.author: BERNARD OF CLAIRVAUX
msItem.title: De diligendo deo
msItem.note: Ed. Leclercq et al., 119–54. The verso is blank, and fol. 157 is not a full leaf, but an irregular tab supplied to hold the short end of the text.

msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus BERNARDI qui dicitur speculum peccatorum
msItem.incipit: Qvoniam karissime in hac uia deficientis uite sumus dies nostri sicut umbra pretereunt
msItem.explicit: et peccata fugias semper tua nouissima in corde diligenter meditando et cetera
msItem.title: Speculum peccatorum
msItem.note: In fact, PS.-AUGUSTINE, ed. PL 40:983–92.

msItem.rubric: Incipit sermo sancti AUGUSTINI de verbis apostoli Fundamentum aliud
msItem.incipit: In his verbis apostoli fratres audiuimus illum dicentem fundamentum aliud
msItem.explicit: et elemosinarum largitate possimus redimere Prestante domino nostro [form ending]
msItem.finalRubric: Amen Explicit sermo [as the initial rubric]
msItem.author: AUGUSTINE
msItem.note: Sermones, App. 104, ed. PL 39:1946–9. Fol. 165v is only about half-filled.

msItem.rubric: Incipit epistola CIRILLI ad Augustinum de mirabilibus que contigerunt post mortem beati Ieronimi presbiteri
msItem.incipit: Venerabili viro episcoporum eximio Augustino yponensi presuli Cirillus ierosolomitanus episcopus omnium sacerdotum infimus Illius sequi uestigia cuius in terris sanctitas radiare non cessat
msItem.explicit: exultent dicentes Dominus soluit compeditos dominus illuminat cecos Cui est honor [form ending] Amen
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit epistola CIRILLI ad beatum Augustinum
msItem.note: In AUGUSTINE, Epistolae App. 19, ed. PL 33:1126–52.

msItem.rubric: Incipit Meditatio BONAUENTURE
msItem.incipit: Anima dei imagine insignita pio saluatoris cruore redempta ceteris creaturis
msItem.explicit: non cesses dicendo Filie ierusalem nuntiate dilecto dicentes quia amore langueo Amen Explicit
msItem.note: Unidentified; the incipit resembles Bloomfield, no. 0412 (BL, MS Burney 359).

msItem.rubric: Incipit Epistola sancti AUGUSTINI Episcopi et doctoris ad Cirillum presbiterum de transitu Ieronimi doctoris
msItem.incipit: Gloriosissime cristiane fidei athlete sancte matris ecclesie lapis angularis
msItem.explicit: potest optinere cum nullatenus possit suo desiderio defraudari vale et ora pro me
msItem.author: AUGUSTINE

supportDesc.foliation: An accurate early modern foliation through fol. 57.

collation.formula: 1–38 48+1 (+9) [fol. 33, a booklet boundary] | 5–98 [fol. 73, a booklet boundary] | 108 118(–8, blank) [fol. 88, a booklet boundary] | 12–148 [fol. 112, a booklet boundary] | 15–168 1712 [fol. 140, a booklet boundary] | 188 198+1 (+9, a large tab, the stub of which shows at the head of the quire, preceding fol. 149) [fol. 157, a booklet boundary] | 208 [fol. 165, a booklet boundary] 21–228 238(–8, blank).
collation.catchwords: Throughout, boxed catchwords at the centre of the leaf (sometimes red-slashed).
collation.signatures: In booklet 1, all leaves in the first half of each quire signed with a letter and a roman numeral, later in brown crayon, quires 1–4 = A–d. At the foot of fol. 33v, in brown crayon, ‘4’ ‘xij Abus’. In booklet 2, most signatures cut away, but quires 6 and 7 bear two sets, on all leaves in the first half: an older one, in which they are e and f; and a more recent series in brown ink, I and k. In Bookets 3–8, all leaves in the first half of each quire signed, with a letter (I–y) and a roman numeral. Quire 11 also bears an older set of signatures, roman numerals only, as do booklets 5–6.

layoutDesc.layout: In long lines, 33 lines to the page. Prickings rare; bounded and ruled in brownish ink.

handDesc.handNote: Written in anglicana formata (with textura r and g, d variable). Punctuation by medial point (often with a tail) and punctus elevatus.

decoDesc.decoNote: Decorated capitals at the heads of texts, most elaborately a 4-line blue capital on violet and gold leaf, with a crude demivinet with buds and a bird in the same colours (fol. 1; a demivinet with gold-leaf leaves and dragon on fol. 110v).
More usual elsewhere is a 4-line blue lombard with gold leaf on red flourishing, sometimes extended to a demivinet with bar border and flourish.
At minor divisions, 2-line blue lombards on red flourishing.
Red-slashed capitals break the text, in some texts red and blue 1-line lombards.
In some texts, running titles in either red or text ink.
See AT, no. 334 (34), dating the book s. xiv ex. and suggesting manufacture at St Albans.

binding.p: Brown leather over millboards, s. xvii, with a stamped fillet. Sewn on five thongs. Nail-holes from a chain-staple in Watson’s position 6, as well as slits in both boards from cloth ribbons to close the book. Gold ‘130’ at the top of the spine, in black ink on leading edges with a note of contents ‘Hugo de Foliet…’ On the leading edge of the lower board a pasted paper tab with the old shelfmark ‘38’. Stamped gold dots on the leading edges of both boards and leading and bottom edges red-flecked. Pastedowns modern paper, a College bookplate on the front pastedown. At the front, four paper flyleaves; at the rear one paper flyleaf (v).
Preceding fol. 1, a fragment from the pastedown of an earlier binding, from a noted service book (one line only).

history.provenance: ‘Hunc librum dedit frater Henricus Wylum fratri Iohanni Bywell per licenciam domini Iohannis [? i.e., Whethamstede] abbatis Monasterii sancti Albani qui liber post mortem predicti fratris Iohannis remanebit in conuentu ciusdem dom cui propicietur ihesus cristus’ (fol. 188v, s. xv1) (Ker MLGB 130, 302; from the latter, the inscription was once more readily legible than now).
history.acquisition: ‘Liber Collegij Diui Johannis Baptistae Oxon’ ex dono Dominj Gulielmi Paddej militis et olim ejusdem Collegij Convictoris 1634’ (fol. ivv at the top; below this, s. xix notes on contents, ascribed by a former St John’s librarian to Miss P. M. Ireland).
